articles.title: Sena's Sanjay Raut Arrested After Questioning, Raids In Land Scam Case
articles.description: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut was arrested at midnight after hours of questioning in connection with the re-development of a chawl in Mumbai. Mr Raut, 60, alleged he was being targeted by the centre to weaken Team Thackeray.
articles.content: <li>"Sanjay Raut has been arrested. BJP is afraid of him and got him arrested. They haven't given us any document (regarding his arrest). He has been framed. He will be produced in court at 11.30 am,… [+2314 chars]

articles.author: Express News Service
articles.title: Use Tricolour on social media, hoist flag at homes as part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav: PM Modi
articles.description: The Prime Minister said that under the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, a special campaign called “Har Ghar Tiranga” is being mobilised between August 13 and 15.
articles.content: TERMING THE Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav a mass movement, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday urged the people to use the Tricolour as their social media profile picture from August 2-15 this year, mar… [+3289 chars]

articles.author: Shaju Philip
articles.title: Kerala youth who died Saturday had tested positive for monkeypox
articles.description: Kerala Health Minister Veena George said the 22-year-old native of Thrissur had no symptoms of monkeypox and that his relatives handed over the test result from abroad only on Saturday.
articles.content: A Kerala youth who died in Thrissur on Saturday had tested positive for monkeypox abroad, state Health Minister Veena George said on Sunday.The 22-year-old youth, a native of Punniyoor in Thrissur, d… [+2071 chars]

articles.author: HT Correspondent
articles.title: ‘Have no income,’ says Partha Chatterjee; ED traces ₹8 crore stashed away in banks
articles.description: Mukherjee, according to ED officials, claimed just the opposite during interrogation, saying Chatterjee and his men stashed the cash in her apartments and she was never allowed to enter those rooms | Latest News India

articles.title: Trains, Road Traffic Affected As Farmers Protest In Punjab, Haryana
articles.description: Farmers on Sunday squatted on railway tracks and blocked roads at several places in Punjab and Haryana as part of the Samyukta Kisan Morcha's nationwide protest against the centre "reneging on its promises".
articles.content:
A BKU leader said: "The centre has gone back on most promises".(Representational)
Chandigarh: Farmers on Sunday squatted on railway tracks and blocked roads at several places in Punjab and Haryana a… [+4119 chars]

articles.title: 3 Jharkhand Congress MLAs who were caught with cash in Bengal arrested
articles.description: Three Jharkhand Congress MLAs who were caught with cash in Bengal have been arrested.
articles.content: Five people, including three Congress MLAs from Jharkhand, who were nabbed with a huge amount of cash in West Bengal, have been arrested. The MLAs were caught with Rs 50 lakh cash in the vehicles the… [+2664 chars]

articles.author: Gautamee Hazarika
articles.title: Rush, chaos outside liquor shops as Delhi govt decides to roll back new excise policy
articles.description: With the withdrawal of the Delhi government’s Excise Policy 2021-22, all privately-owned liquor outlets will have to shut shop.
articles.content: New Delhi: Imported alcohol at half price, bottles flying off the shelves and long queues these were the scenes outside liquor stores in Delhi following Deputy CM Manish Sisodias announcement Saturda… [+5000 chars]

articles.title: Who is IPS Sanjay Arora, appointed as Commissioner of Delhi Police
articles.description: IPS officer Sanjay Arora was appointed as the Delhi Police Commissioner on Sunday.
articles.content:
IPS officer Sanjay Arora was appointed as the Delhi Police Commissioner on Sunday. He will become the new commissioner from August 1.

articles.title: "No Need To Panic": Aviation Regulator Chief On Recent Flight Snags
articles.description: Aviation watchdog DGCA's chief Arun Kumar today said technical snags faced by domestic carriers in recent weeks did not have potential to cause havoc and that even foreign airlines that came to India reported 15 technical snags in the last 16 days.
articles.content:
None of the events had the potential to cause havoc, the aviation regulator chief said (Representational)
